title: rustdoc unexpectedly formatted leading numeral as a list

labels.name: T-rustdoc
labels.description: Relevant to the rustdoc team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: regression-from-stable-to-stable
labels.description: Performance or correctness regression from one stable version to another.

body:
I have a feeling I'm doing something wrong here so I apologize in advance if this is just noise.  But the behavior I'm seeing seems surprising.

I tried this code:

```rust
//! 1. One
//!    1. Two
//!
//! This record means: user 123 has the "admin" role on the "project" with id
//! 234.  (Note.)
```

and I built this with `cargo doc`.

I expected to see this sentence together in one paragraph: "This record means: user 123 has the "admin" role on the "project" with id 234.  (Note.)"

Instead, this happened:

![rustdoc](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/532688/146440469-9c7b7e62-8e59-4ec6-928d-2d345c09ddb7.png)

Looking at the HTML, it's interpreted the leading "234." as a numbered list.  Thinking this was some Markdown error, I [tried it in the dingus but it does what I expected](https://spec.commonmark.org/dingus/?text=1.%20One%0A%20%20%201.%20Two%0A%0AThis%20record%20means%3A%20user%20123%20has%20the%20%22admin%22%20role%20on%20the%20%22project%22%20with%20id%0A234.%20%20(Note.)).

### Meta

```
$ cargo version
cargo 1.56.0 (4ed5d137b 2021-10-04)
```

```
$ rustdoc --version --verbose
rustdoc 1.56.1 (59eed8a2a 2021-11-01)
binary: rustdoc
commit-hash: 59eed8a2aac0230a8b53e89d4e99d55912ba6b35
commit-date: 2021-11-01
host: x86_64-apple-darwin
release: 1.56.1
LLVM version: 13.0.0
```

On `cargo 1.59.0-nightly (a359ce160 2021-12-14)`, I see almost the same behavior, but the "2" in 234 gets eaten:

![rustdoc-nightly](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/532688/146441233-835fd323-f632-486f-9e49-5f90ba0b4d7c.png)
